Package common.controllers

Class AbstractScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.controllers.AbstractScreen
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BookingScreenController, BookingViewScreenController, CancellationReportController, CancellationScreenController, CheckingNotificationsScreenController, ClientConnectionController, ConfirmationScreenController, DepartmentManagerAccountScreenController, DepartmentManagerReportsScreenController, GroupGuideRegistrationScreenController, MainScreenController, ParametersAdjustingScreenConrtroller, ParametersApprovingScreenConrtroller, ParkEmployeeAccountScreenController, ParkEntryManagementScreenController, ParkEntryReservationScreenController, ParkManagerAccountScreenController, ParkManagerReportScreenController, ParkVisitorAccountScreenController, PaymentSystemScreenController, RescheduleScreenController, ServerConnectionController, ServiceRepresentativeAccountScreenController, TotalNumberOfVisitorsReportController, UsageReportController, VisitReportController, WaitingListScreenController
    public abstract class AbstractScreen
extends java.lang.Object
    The AbstractScreen is the abstract class of each screen class in the application. Includes multiple methods that are common for all screens, including Alert showing, CSS and styles methods, etc. A screen can also be Stateful (implementing the Stateful interface), if in some cases it has to save its current data and state, for future restoring and use.

      • getScreenTitle

        public abstract java.lang.String getScreenTitle()

      • handleCloseRequest

        public void handleCloseRequest​(javafx.stage.WindowEvent event)
        This method is activated after the X is clicked on the window. The default is to show a Confirmation Alert with "Yes" and "No" options for the user to choose. "Yes" will check if the client is connected to the server, disconnect it if necessary and close the window. "No" will "consume" the request, meaning it will cancel the closing request and will keep the window open. This method can be overriden for different implementations.
        Parameters:
        event - the event of clicking on the X of the window

      • showErrorAlert

        public final void showErrorAlert​(java.lang.String content)
        This method uses Alert to show an error alert message on the screen
        Parameters:
        stage - the application's primary stage
        content - the content to be displayed inside the error alert

      • showInformationAlert

        public final void showInformationAlert​(java.lang.String content)
        This method uses Alert to show an information alert message on the screen
        Parameters:
        content - the content to be displayed inside the information alert

      • showConfirmationAlert

        public final int showConfirmationAlert​(java.lang.String content,
                                       java.util.List<java.lang.Object> buttonsText)
        Parameters:
        content - the content to be displayed inside the confirmation alert
        buttonsText - an array list of the text to be shown in every button. The size of this array list of strings, will determine how many buttons will be displayed.
        Returns:
        the index of the button which was clicked

      • setFieldToError

        public final java.lang.String setFieldToError()
        Setting a CSS style for indicating an error in a text field input
        Returns:
        the string to be set inside setStyle() method of JavaFX

        public final java.lang.String setFieldToRegular()
